intro: Phyllanthus srilankanus, commonly known as the Sri Lankan phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to Sri Lanka. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, glossy leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features include alternate leaves and a unique inflorescence structure. It is also noted for its potential medicinal uses in traditional herbal practices.
